{{Marvel Database:Organization Template | Image = Tricorp from Amazing Spider-Man Vol 2 1 001.png | Name = Tricorp | Aliases = | Leaders = Dr. [[Ted Twaki]] | CurrentMembers = [[Javier Caldrone (Earth-616)|Javier Caldrone]]; [[Stan Hardy (Earth-616)|Stan Hardy]]; [[Terry Kwan (Earth-616)|Terry Kwan]]; [[Cassandra Locke (Earth-700)|Cassandra Locke]]; [[Chantal Stone (Earth-616)|Chantal Stone]]; [[Walter Thorson (Earth-616)|Walter Thorson]]; | FormerMembers = [[Christina Carr (Earth-616)|Dr. Christina Carr]]; [[Otto Octavius (Earth-616)|Dr. Otto Octavius]]; [[Peter Parker (Earth-616)|Peter Parker]]; | Identity = Public | Affiliation = | Allies = | Enemies = [[Christina Carr (Earth-616)|Captain Power]]; [[Ghost]] | Origin = | Reality = Earth-616 | Status = Active | BaseOfOperations = Tricorp Research Foundation, [[New York]] | PlaceOfFormation = [[Los Angeles]], [[California (State)|California]] | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Howard Mackie; John Byrne; Scott Hanna; | First = Amazing Spider-Man Vol 2 1 | History = The Tricorp Research Foundation was a private brain trust, with unlimited resources, which served as a playground for the best of the best of the [[United States of America|country's]] scientific minds.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 2 #1}}
As he received the news of a fight between [[Martha Franklin (Earth-616)|Spider-Man]] and [[Gregory Herd (Earth-616)|Shadrac]] at [[Osborn Laboratories|Osborn Industries]], [[Theodore Twaki (Earth-616)|Dr. Twaki]] sent a team on the scene to learn Spider-Man's secrets.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 2 #2}}
A few days later, [[Christina Carr (Earth-616)|Captain Power]] assaulted the Tricorp to kill Dr. Twaki, but she eventually was defeated by Spider-Man.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 2 #10}} | Equipment = | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }} [[Category:Companies]] [[Category:Think Tanks]]
